column1: Bavette's Bar & Boeuf////Before we even get into the meat of things
column2: lets talk about the bread basket. Easily
column3: one of if not the best breads I've ever had in a restaurant. They could easily charge $5 a basket and have people dish out for it. Thick chunks of fresh
column4: piping hot (not just warm) bread comes to the table with a tub of butter. Yes
column5: tons of butter. This is how every restaurant should serve their bread. Without getting too detailed
column9: luscious and almost silky. The butter melted almost instantly upon spreading
column10: and the bread literally melted like cotton candy once it hit my tongue. A great way to get introduced to such a fine establishment.
